content: Coal mining— even with the best safeguards in place — is incredibly difficult, dangerous, unhealthy work. It needs to be replaced with other work, but those jobs need to be good jobs — not low-pay deadend service jobs — and when people start talking about “tourism” they are talking about low-pay, deadend, service jobs. So, we absolutely have to get serious — a Marshall Plan for the Appalachians — and do it right.
